1470505315842109445.text: Throughout the pandemic, viewers across the country have relied on community media to stay safe, healthy, and informed. The Protecting Community Television Act will ensure that community TV operations continue to receive the resources they need to educate and inform viewers.

1470505313736474628.text: As a result, local governments have to decide between supporting PEG stations in cable franchise agreements and supporting other important services for critical community institutions like schools and libraries.

1470505311379369990.text: However, in August, 2019, the FCC voted to permit cable companies to assign a value to these contributions and then subtract that amount from the franchise fees the cable operator pays the local community.

1470505309110214668.text: Currently, local governments are permitted to require that cable companies meet demonstrated community needs by providing in-kind contributions that benefit schools, public safety buildings, and public, educational, and government (PEG) channels, known as community TV stations.

1470505306245505035.text:
In this era of media consolidation and globalization, it is critical that we preserve community media that lifts up local voices. I'm proud to reintroduce the Protecting Community Television Act with @SenatorBaldwin, @RepAnnaEshoo, and @RepPeterDeFazio.

1237843069182939137.text: 6. Protect consumers. That includes shielding them from scams and price gouging, which I called on Amazon to do. No one should be allowed to reap a windfall from fear and human suffering.

1237842958189121538.text: 5. Enhance Unemployment Insurance and expand and support programs like SNAP, WIC, school lunch and other initiatives, to support food security. And banks should suspend payments on mortgages for those struggling with the economic impacts of this crisis.

1237842956733706240.text: 4. Ensure paid sick leave for our workers. We need to pass Senator @PattyMurray’s legislation to provide an additional 14 days sick leave immediately in the event of any public health emergency, including the current coronavirus crisis.

1237842662931103752.text: 3. Increase the Federal Medicaid Assistance Percentage or FMAP. This would increase the amount of federal dollars that go into Medicaid, immediately pumping more resources into states to deal with this health crisis.

1237842661827964930.text: 2. We need widespread and free coronavirus testing, and affordable treatment for all.

1237842660418699267.text: 1. The President should immediately declare the coronavirus pandemic an emergency. That declaration would allow FEMA access to over $42 billion dollars in the Disaster Relief Fund, and support states and communities directly as they deal with the spread of this virus.

1237842540620996609.text:
As of this afternoon, we are officially facing a global pandemic.

We need our response to the coronavirus emergency to match the seriousness of the crisis. Here’s my plan to address #COVID19. THREAD: https://t.co/uoNaKakc0a

1237829643605905408.text:
With all of the uncertainty around the #COVID19 pandemic, I want my constituents to be certain of one thing: your safety is my top priority. 
 
I’m on the Senate floor laying out what must be done to combat this public health emergency. Watch LIVE: https://t.co/nLEhqrY7VT

1237814744305844224.text: The White House Coronavirus Task Force must be fully supportive of Massachusetts’s on-the-ground response. I’m joining the entire Mass. delegation in urging VP Pence to take swift, specific action to support state, local, and tribal governments as they combat #COVID19. https://t.co/uAk9auRRFr

1237766926149042178.text: Due to concerns about the spread of COVID-19 and the state of emergency declared by Governor Baker, we have decided to postpone the town hall in Greenfield on Monday, March 16th. We very much look forward to rescheduling at an appropriate time. https://t.co/ln8XPN9pkg

1237759939973730304.text:
The FTC shouldn't allow any consumer to suffer from a scam or predatory business practice during this public health emergency. I’m urging the FTC to immediately develop & deploy a comprehensive plan for protecting consumers during the coronavirus outbreak.
https://t.co/WMFElBtuuc

1237503121397514241.text: Without T-Band, first responders across the country will lose a critical communication tool. Our heroes need help. Proud to fight with IAFF, @IAFC, the Greater Boston Police Council, and others to ensure our firefighters, police officers, and EMS have the tools they need. https://t.co/xzswzB1gZ3

1237461225446965250.text: The White House is proposing to bail out the fossil fuel industry. We need more coronavirus testing, not more fracking. We should be working to pass a #GreenNewDeal and deliver climate justice, not delivering an unjust payout to Trump’s billionaire oil and gas cronies. https://t.co/DMlmTuyEoX

1237435895227256835.text: Students who have been defrauded by predatory for-profit colleges deserve protections and recourse. But Betsy DeVos gutted an Obama administration rule leaving students vulnerable. Proud to support @SenatorDurbin’s resolution to put #StudentsFirst and reverse DeVos’s decision.

1237418432536117249.text: During an emergency, whether it’s a house fire or a terrorist attack, first responders rely on T-Band frequency to communicate with each other. Without Congressional action they will lose this tool. Congress must support our first responders and protect T-Band access. https://t.co/B0I9l5qCHK

1237413420623855616.text: Every day, from Boston to New York to L.A., firefighters and police officers use their T-Band-connected radios to do their jobs. But without Congressional action, they will lose access to T-Band frequency. Let’s save T-Band access so first responders can save lives. https://t.co/VY7dtBp9Bc

1237409293005135872.text: When a firefighter reaches for her radio to call for backup, she relies on T-Band frequency. But if Congress doesn’t act, first responders will lose this tool. We must protect T-Band so firefighters & police officers have the tools they need to save lives. https://t.co/cT1RgVMhLe

1235661899427196929.text: This is welcome news and I'm pleased Congress is moving quickly to respond to #COVID19. But we need to anticipate and prepare for these threats, not just react to them. Congress should also pass my legislation to put $1 billion toward research for a universal coronavirus vaccine. https://t.co/tPTyfCPd9P

1235634189673914368.text: Allowing any airline to charge exorbitant fees for ticket changes or cancellations during the coronavirus outbreak is beyond unfair. @SenWarren and I are urging @USDOT to act without delay and suspend all airline ticket cancellation and change fees during this emergency. https://t.co/kd2UtZd93S

1235610497484980226.text: By the age of 12 more than two-thirds of kids have their own smartphone, and more than twice as many young people watch videos every day than did in 2015. It’s time to get serious about protecting children online. Thank you @SenBlumenthal for your partnership on the #KIDSAct.

1235610495186419713.text: Websites and apps are using features like auto-play to manipulate kids into staying on their platforms as long as possible. The #KIDSAct will ban these damaging features on platforms for kids so they don’t develop unhealthy habits. https://t.co/EFq3bv5xcc

1235610493047525377.text: Parents should know what videos appear on the websites their kids view. The #KIDSAct will create transparency by establishing an annual audit of the top children’s websites and creating a labeling system so parents know what online material is suitable for kids. https://t.co/JJpWRDjLWW

1235610491126460416.text: If you feel bombarded by online advertisements and disturbing internet content, think how vulnerable children are. We need to ban product placement and unboxing videos for kids. Children don’t have the cognitive skills to determine that these videos are ads. #KIDSAct https://t.co/86UUUqPMa2

1235610489180352512.text: We need strong rules to keep kids safe online. Today, I’m introducing the #KIDSAct to make sure children aren’t being manipulated by dangerous features, inappropriately advertised to, or exposed to harmful content. https://t.co/ToDxVYPch7

1235333750323630080.text:
